label: ham
subject: Stock Notification for ONEOK Inc.
body: 130 (return) [ The fable of the pygmies is as old as Homer, (Iliad. iii. 6) The pygmies of India and ®thiopia were (trispithami) twenty-seven inches high. Every spring their cavalry (mounted on rams and goats) marched, in battle array, to destroy the cranesÕ eggs, aliter (says Pliny) futuris gregibus non resisti. Their houses were built of mud, feathers, and egg-shells. See Pliny, (vi. 35, vii. 2,) and Strabo, (l. ii. p. 121.)]
